Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2016 05:52PM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: Shopgirl - You are the bigger, classier, smarter person. What a miserable heart she must have. Boo hiss. Thanks for everyone for posting your pictures. At 6 weeks PFC with not a hint of hair returning anywhere, it's inspirational for me. Saw this on Twitter today and thought of all of us!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2016 01:16PM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: Love all the stories about late eyebrow/eyelash loss and sparse eyebrow return - my experience too! I have very short hair and thin eyebrows at 10 wks PFC. Decided to try my first no-hat outing today. Didn't get any out-and-out staring, but caught most women glancing, looking shocked and then determinedly looking away. My take: some might be offended by the GI Jane look. But I think most flash on CANCER OMG THAT WOMAN HAD/HAS CANCER and are extremely uncomfortable. Unsure whether I'll go hatless again until I've achieved a decent pixie in a couple of months. But it was an interesting experiment.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2016 02:28PM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: MDW - I'm 8 wks PFC tomorrow and have the same "receding hairline" problem. Worst case: I'll grow it longer at the crown and comb forward for a "Hail, Caesar!" look. ; ) One_Bad: Ain't this randomness the worst? At least I have baby eyelashes and eyebrow hairs now....

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2016 01:20PM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: Sloan - Gorgeous! Having a tough day and you are giving me hope - thank you for sharing your lovely progress.

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2016 09:51AM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: Trvler - At nearly 11 weeks PFC, I'm experiencing the opposite! Leg hair is much thinner and softer than it was before, but it's growing faster than the hair on my head!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 11, 2016 04:07PM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: Here's my hair regrowth at 14 weeks PFC. Photo doesn't do it justice because it came in last / thinnest up front. (What looks like a male-pattern baldness area here is covered in thin, white hair.) The hair is back is dark, thicker and longer. Husband clipped the scraggly ends at my nape today and neatened it.  I go out without any head covering (unless it's chilly enough for a cap) and ignore the stares. Feels so great to go hat-less!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2016 04:47PM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: mvspaulding - Had my eyebrows until SO late in the process - it sucked to lose them. I have been surprised at how much has grown between weeks 8 and 10 (now). My eyelashes seemed to regrow overnight and brows are slowly filling in. Hang in there - it will start to come back soon.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2016 06:49AM Minnesota_LisaFR wrote: inSF - Mine looked like SouthernCharm's at 6-7 weeks. My hair returned much stronger/sooner in the back than front and crown and I worried about weird male-pattern baldness look. Now at 13 weeks PFC, it's filling in everywhere. (The male-pattern areas are gray and thinner, but that was true pre-chemo.) I shared your worries at 6 weeks, but now go in public hat-free. You will be there soon!
